#summary ASEPRITE Wiki front page.

Quoting Wikipedia a sprite is:

  `[...]` a two-dimensional image or animation that is integrated into a larger scene. [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sprite_(computer_graphics) [Source]]

You can use ASEPRITE to create animated sprites, static [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tile-based_video_game tiles], or just [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pixel_art pixel art]. Basically you can manipulate any kind of [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raster_image raster graphics], where images are conformed by a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pixel grid of pixels], little squares distributed in a rectangular way. E.g. When you see a photo in your computer, you almost does not notice the existence of pixels (they are too small). But when you see little images in your [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile_game mobile phone], you can appreciate the pixels. ASEPRITE is a program to see and manipulate pixels, to create this kind of little images.
